<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Insert into the map all the informations contained in the operand bundles of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the llvm.assume. This should be used instead of hasAttributeInAssume when</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><Highlight kind="comment">/// many queries are going to be made on the same llvm.assume.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><Highlight kind="comment">/// String attributes are not inserted in the map.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><Highlight kind="comment">/// If the IR changes the map will be outdated.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ad0cb3b7526df89b44d7c13b54cd25a51">fillMapFromAssume</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/assumeinst">AssumeInst</a> &amp;Assume, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a681f4982ace03237b4578f1280eef12e">RetainedKnowledgeMap</a> &amp;Result);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Represent one information held inside an operand bundle of an llvm.assume.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><Highlight kind="comment">/// AttrKind is the property that holds.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><Highlight kind="comment">/// WasOn if not null is that Value for which AttrKind holds.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><Highlight kind="comment">/// ArgValue is optionally an argument of the attribute.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><Highlight kind="comment">/// For example if we know that %P has an alignment of at least four:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><Highlight kind="comment">///  - AttrKind will be Attribute::Alignment.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><Highlight kind="comment">///  - WasOn will be %P.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><Highlight kind="comment">///  - ArgValue will be 4</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
